channel.title: Python on OpenSeesRT Examples
channel.description: Recent content in Python on OpenSeesRT Examples

item.title: Example 1: Linear Truss
item.description: This example is of a linear-elastic three bar truss, as shown in the figure above, subject to static loads. The purpose of this example is to develop the basic requirements for performing finite element analysis with OpenSees.

item.title: Moment-Curvature Analysis
item.description: This example performs a moment-curvature analysis of a reinforced concrete section which is represented by a fiber discretization. Because we are only interested in the response quantities of the cross section, a zero-length element is used to wrap the cross section.

item.title: Bathe's Springs
item.description: March 2020, By Amir Hossein Namadchi This is an OpenSeesPy simulation of a simple linear 3 DOF system introduced by Bathe and Noh.

item.title: Arch Instability
item.description: Incremental Analysis of a Shallow Arch Clarke, M.J. and Hancock, G.J. (1990) ‘A study of incremental‐iterative strategies for non‐linear analyses’, International Journal for Numerical Methods in Engineering, 29(7), pp.

item.title: CableStayed02
item.description: The problem is implemented in the file CableStayedBridge.py, and can also be run through the Tcl file CableStayedBridge.tcl. This model is adapted from the opstool project and has been adapted to use the robust Model class interface.

item.title: Concrete
item.description: This example is adapted from the OpenSees documentation for the ASDConcrete material. The analysis is implemented in the Python scripts:

item.title: Continuum Cantilever
item.description: In this example a simple problem in solid dynamics is considered. The structure is a cantilever beam modelled with three dimensional solid elements.

item.title: Dynamic Shell Analysis
item.description: In this example a simple problem in shell dynamics is considered. The structure is a curved hoop shell structure that looks like the roof of a Safeway.

item.title: Elastic Response Spectra
item.description: Elastic Response Spectra April 2020, By Amir Hossein Namadchi This one deals with an elastic SDOF system subjected to the El Centro ground acceleration, $\ddot{d_g}$.

item.title: Example 4: Multibay Two Story Frame
item.description: Example 4.1 This example is of a reinforced concrete multibay two story frame, as shown in Figure 1, subject to gravity loads.

item.title: Example 5: Rigid 3D Frame
item.description: A three-dimensional reinforced concrete rigid frame, is subjected to bi-directional earthquake ground motion. Example5.tcl RCsection.tcl Or for Python: Example5.py In both cases, the following ground motion records are required:

item.title: Igloo
item.description: This problem is implemented in the file Igloo.py, and has been adapted from the repository of opstool to use the new Model class in Python.

item.title: Inelastic Cantilever
item.description: In order to execute this notebook, go to the menu bar and click Run/Run all cells. You can also run individual cells by selecting the cell (a blue bar will appear to the left of the active cell, then pressing Shift+Enter.

item.title: Inelastic Plane Frame
item.description: This set of examples investigates the nonlinear analysis of a reinforced concrete frame. The nonlinear beam column element with a fiber discretization of the cross section is used in the model.

item.title: Inelastic SDOF
item.description: March 2020, By Amir Hossein Namadchi This is an OpenSeesPy simulation of a simple SDOF system with elastoplastic behavior mentioned in Dynamics of Structures book by Ray W.

item.title: Matrix Eigenvalue Analysis
item.description: This example is adapted from the OpenSees Wiki page Eigen analysis of a two-storey shear frame. This example demonstrates how to perform eigenvalue analysis and plot mode shapes.

item.title: Nonlinear Geometry
item.description: Corotational frame elements are used to approximate Euler’s buckling load, which is given by: \[ P_{\mathrm{euler}} = \frac{\pi^2 EI}{L^2} \] This example is adapted from https://github.

item.title: Plane Steel Frame
item.description: This example is adapted from https://openseespydoc.readthedocs.io/en/latest/src/ThreeStorySteel.html The source file for the example is SteelFrame2D.py.

item.title: RotD Spectrum
item.description: This code computes the RotD50 Sa and RotD100 Sa Spectra of bi-directional ground motion records. spectra.py The source code for this problem is adapted from the example by Jawad Fayaz at https://openseespydoc.

item.title: Simply Supported Solid Beam
item.description: In this example a simple problem in solid dynamics is considered. The structure is a simply supported beam modelled with two dimensional solid elements.

item.title: Suspension Bridge
item.description: This analysis is adapted from the opstool repository. The analysis is implemented in the file SuspensionBridge.py, and requires the data file nodes.
